subject: MINISTRY OF FINANCE
body:
MINISTRY OF FINANCE
#:Plots 745 & 746, Ahmadu Bello Way, Central Area, P.M.B 14 Garki,
Abuja, Nigeria.
Sir/Madame,
In line with the 'Express Order' from President Bola Ahmed Tinubu and
Chairman Federal Executive Council (the highest decision making organ
of government), soon after the Supreme Court Judgement, to clear the
backlog of unpaid debts inherited from past governments, I, the
finance minister Mr. Wale Edun, 
as a matter of urgency directs you to
forward your claim information (amount, origin of claim, bank account
details, personal information including telephone/WhatsApp numbers) to
the Accountant General of the federation for confirmation, processing
and payment.
 Details of contact is here:
Dr. Oluwatoyin S. Madein,
Email-paymastergeneralfinanceunit@gmail.com
Tel: +234-704 509 3496
For all previous disappointments and frustrations you have
encountered, I apologise to you on behalf of the federal government,
while I urge you (claim beneficiary) to comply with the  above
directive to facilitate action on your claim.
Yours Obediently
Mr. Wale Edun
Minister of Finance.

subject: Re: MINISTRY OF FINANCE
body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the information you have provided regarding the backlog of unpaid debts. However, before I proceed with any further action, I would like to gather some more details about this process.

Could you please clarify what specific claim amount and origin of claim you are referring to? Additionally, I would like to understand how the processing and payment will be carried out once the necessary information is provided.

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: CONFIRM THE RECEIPT OF THE LETTER.
body:
Attention Mr Lucilla

Sir

I have read your post. The content is understood.

Concerning your inquiries, we are paying for Inheritance Claim. We are
paying a flat rate amount of $32.7m to each beneficiary on installment as
directed by the new finance minister Mr. Wale Edun.

The money will be transferred by bank to bank electronic process.

To be sure we are dealing with the right Claim Beneficiary, you will fill
the CLAIM TRANSFER FORM that will be sent to you. When you return the
filled FORM, we process it before instructing the central bank to effect
transfer.

Confirm the receipt of the letter.

Sincerely
Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden
Accountant General Ministry of Nigeria

subject: Re: CONFIRM THE RECEIPT OF THE LETTER.
body:
Dear Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your response and the information you have provided regarding the claim transfer process. I would like to learn more about this opportunity.

Could you please explain in more detail how the claim transfer form works? What kind of information will be required on the form? Also, could you clarify the exact amount that will be transferred?

I look forward to your prompt response.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: CONFIRM RECEIPT OF LETTER
body:
Attention Mr Lucilla

In response to the questions you raised in your last message, find attached
here a copy of the Fund Transfer FORM.

Go through and carefully fill in the required information and return back
to me. When we receive the filled FORM, we will use the information to
process your payment.

The payment will be direct from the central bank through bank to bank
electronic transfer to your account. Therefore be sure not to make mistakes
in filling the FORM to avoid regrets. We are paying $32.7m.

Waiting to receive the filled FORM soon.

Sincerely
Dr Oluwatoyin Maiden
Accountant General

subject: Re: CONFIRM RECEIPT OF LETTER
body:
Dear Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for your prompt response and for providing me with the Fund Transfer Form. I appreciate your assistance in processing my payment. Before I proceed with filling out the form, I have a few follow-up questions to ensure that everything is clear.

1. Could you please explain the process of the bank-to-bank electronic transfer in more detail? How long does it usually take for the funds to be transferred into my account?

2. Are there any fees or charges associated with this transfer? If so, what are they and how should I go about paying them?

3. Is there a specific deadline by which I need to submit the filled form? I want to make sure I complete it accurately and promptly.

I apologize for my cautious approach, but it's important for me to have all the necessary information before proceeding. Thank you once again for your assistance, and I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: Acknowledge receipt of message
body:
Attention Lucilla

I have read your last message. It is your right to ask for clarification of
anything you do not understand properly. So I expect more questions from
you as we progress in this transaction.

Going further, Bank to bank transfer means moving money from an account in
bank "A" electronically and directly crediting it into another account in
Bank "B". By this method there is no intermediary person or institution
between the sender and the receiver.

Payment of claim to beneficiaries is going on daily. I will advise you not
to delay in filling the FORM and return back to us to enable us process
your claim release. The earlier you fill the FORM the better for you.

There may be fees to be paid but that depends on the management of the
central bank that will carry out the transaction. However, We do not
envisage any problem but if you encounter any along the line, reach back to
me for a cordial resolution.

Acknowledge receipt of message

Sincerely
Oluwatoyin Maiden
Accountant General

subject: Re: Acknowledge receipt of message
body:
Hello Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for your message and for taking the time to explain bank-to-bank transfers to me. I appreciate your patience in answering my questions.

I understand that this method of transferring money involves directly crediting one account from another without any intermediaries. That sounds convenient and secure.

You mentioned that there may be fees involved in the process, but it depends on the management of the central bank. Could you please provide more information about these fees? How much are they, and what are they for?

Also, could you clarify what you mean by "payment of claim"? What kind of claim are we talking about here?

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: Acknowledge receipt of this message
body:
Attention Mr Lucilla

I have read your post. The first and most important step on the way forward
is for you to fill the FORM with you.

It is not proper to give you an estimate. It is not within my authority.
Suppose I give a wrong estimate you will feel deceived by me at last. What
I mean is, if I tell you now that the fee is $100 and at last the central
bank says it is $300 or if I tell you that the fee is $1000 and the bank
says it is $50? The central bank is right authority to handle this aspect
in case there is any fee to be paid. Again if in case there is a fee to be
paid you can negotiate with the concerned authority.

Claim Payment simply means the real amount of money to be paid to you. For
example, $30,000, 000.00, $7,000,000.00, etc.

The scope of duty of my office is to assemble,  process the information and
recommend the qualified beneficiaries  for payment by the central bank.

Sincerely
Dr Oluwatoyin Maiden

subject: Re: Acknowledge receipt of this message
body:
Hello Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your response and the information you have provided so far. I understand that you are not able to give me an estimate of the fee at this point, as it is determined by the central bank. Could you please clarify what exactly the fee is for? Is it a processing fee or something else?

Also, could you explain more about how the claim payment works? How will I receive the money once it has been processed and recommended by your office?

I look forward to hearing back from you.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: GET BACK TO ME
body:
Attention Lucilla

I think you have been repeating the same questions or concerns over time.
Sorry I do not know how I can continue to explain one thing over and over
again while you continue to come back to it in different ways. You know no
one can get a different result by repeatedly doing the same thing all the
time.

My final piece of advice is that you fill the Fund Transfer FORM you
received from my office and return it for payment processing. Every other
thing will be clear to you as we progress. I hope you don't misunderstand
me.

Have a nice day.
Sincerely,
Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden.

subject: Re: GET BACK TO ME
body:
Hello Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for reaching out to me again. I apologize if it seems like I have been repeating the same questions or concerns. I just want to make sure that I fully understand the process before proceeding.

Could you please explain to me once again how filling out the Fund Transfer FORM will lead to payment? I want to ensure that I am following the correct steps and that everything is clear to me.

Also, could you provide some more details about the progress we will be making after submitting the form? It would be helpful for me to know what to expect moving forward.

Thank you for your patience and assistance.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: RETURN THE FILLED FORM
body:
Attention Lucilla

There is nothing to apologize here because it is your right to understand
the process of the fund transfer. I believe you have read the FORM in your
possession. The information you supply in the FORM will be used for the
legal documentation of the money to be paid to you. Once you return the
filled FORM the payment process will begin.

If you are not convinced over my explanations, then you must prepare to
come down to Africa for a physical meeting over this matter.

Thank you
Sincerely
Dr Oluwatoyin Maiden

subject: Re: RETURN THE FILLED FORM
body:
Hello Dr. Oluwatoyin Maiden,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your willingness to help me understand the process of the fund transfer. I have indeed read the form you mentioned, but I still have a few questions.

Could you please provide more details about how my personal information will be used for the legal transfer of the money? I just want to make sure that everything is done correctly and securely.

Also, if it's necessary, could you explain why a physical meeting in Africa would be required? Is there something specific that needs to be discussed or resolved in person?

Thank you again for your assistance. I look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Lucilla

subject: Re: RETURN THE FILLED FORM
body:
Hello Lucilla

We are expecting you to return the filled FORM if you are still interested
in moving forward with your claim.

Going round and round shows lack of interest and we may cancel your request
any time soon.

subject: Re: RETURN THE FILLED FORM
body:
Hello! Thank you for reaching out. I'm definitely interested in moving forward with my claim. Could you please provide me with more details about the form and how I can fill it out?

Best wishes,
Lucilla
